Nutrition: Focusing on a healthy diet with plenty of fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats is a great way to keep oneself healthy. A balanced diet can go a long way in boosting the immune system and warding off various illnesses.

Traditional Healing Practices: Exploring traditional healing practices from different cultures, such as Ayurveda, acupuncture, and chiropractic treatment can help people maintain their health. These practices can be learned through books and online resources, and can be practiced at home.

First Aid and Basic Medical Knowledge: Having a comprehensive understanding of basic medical knowledge and first aid techniques can help people identify and treat minor injuries and illnesses. Online resources and first aid courses can be accessed to learn these skills.

Building a Community: Creating a community of people who share knowledge and resources can be beneficial in times of medical crisis. People can exchange ideas and experiences, and support each other in times of need.

Emergency Medical Supplies: Keeping a well-stocked first aid kit and emergency medical supplies, such as pain relievers, bandages, and basic medical equipment, can help people handle minor injuries and illnesses. These supplies can be easily available at home and in the community.
